channel.title: Game Rant - Gaming News | RSS Feed
channel.description: The biggest video game news, rumors, previews, and info about the PC, PS4, Xbox, Switch, & mobile titles you play.

item.title: Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin's Demo is a Great Chance to Try The Game Before Launch
item.dc:creator: Jared Carvalho
item.description: The latest demo for Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin gives players a last opportunity to test the waters of this new look for an old IP.
item.content:encoded: The latest demo for Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin offers players a unique opportunity that many don't see often in modern gaming. Considering the depth of classes in Stranger of Paradise and the difficulty that comes with adopting Team Ninja's gameplay style, this look into the game could be the best way to introduce Final Fantasy fans.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Arceus Fan Creates Incredible Real-Life Version of Game's Pokedex
item.dc:creator: Clayton Sterling Cyre
item.description: Pokemon Legends: Arceus inspires countless fan creations including a real-life version of the Pokemon spin-off title's old-fashioned Hisui Pokedex.
item.content:encoded: Nintendo and Game Freak released Pokemon Legends: Arceus over a month ago and Pokemon fans continue to discover hidden details, fill in their Pokedex, and create unique items inspired by the game. Joining others in unique art projects, one Pokemon Legends: Arceus fan has made a real-life version of the game's Pokedex in celebration of the spin-off Pokemon title.

item.title: Pokemon GO Adding New Region Exclusive Pokemon
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: Niantic details the Festival of Colors event in Pokemon GO, which will include the debut of a new region-exclusive Pokemon.
item.content:encoded: Pokemon GO is in the midst of the Season of Alola, in which it is slowly introducing Pokemon from the Alola region to the popular augmented reality mobile game. So far, all the new Generation 7 Pokemon added to Pokemon GO as part of the Season of Alola have been available across the board, but that will be changing soon with the introduction of a new region-exclusive Pokemon.

item.title: Super Nintendo World Opening Next Year in US
item.dc:creator: Neil Rickus
item.description: Following the opening of Super Nintendo World in Japan last year, more details are emerging about Nintendo’s US theme park.
item.content:encoded: After a successful launch in Japan, further information has been released about the first Super Nintendo World theme park in the US. As one might expect, this news is exciting for many fans that have been eagerly anticipating when a Nintendo theme park will open in other locations following Super Nintendo World finally opening last year.

item.title: LEGO Princess Peach Super Mario Sets Revealed
item.dc:creator: Kevin James Billings
item.description: Princess Peach is making her debut, in LEGO form, when the new expansion set hits shelves in Summer 2022.
item.content:encoded: Countless pop culture icons have been given the LEGO treatment and are available for fans to own in small brick form. This list includes one of gaming's biggest names, Mario, with some of the most interactive LEGO sets the toy company has ever put out. To celebrate Mario Day 2022, the plumber's better-half, Princess Peach, is now getting in on the action with a new expansion set for the Mushroom Kingdom's ruler.

item.title: Apple Claims New M1 Ultra SoC Beats GeForce RTX 3090
item.dc:creator: Daniel DeAngelo
item.description: Apple claims that the company’s new M1 Ultra processor used in the upcoming Mac Studio PC outperforms Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 3090 graphics card.
item.content:encoded: Many gamers regard Nvidia’s GeForce RTX line as the gold standard of GPUs. While some have criticized the GeForce RTX 3090 as overpriced, it’s still the fastest graphics card currently on the market.

item.title: Kirby and the Forgotten Land Demo Mod Gives Kirby a Devil May Cry Makeover
item.dc:creator: Nicola Jean Kapron
item.description: One Kirby fan takes advantage of the Kirby and the Forgotten Land demo release to make a mod that gives Kirby a Devil May Cry-style makeover.
item.content:encoded: Kirby is one of the most iconic characters in video game history, and with Kirby and the Forgotten Land rapidly approaching launch, many fans have begun to celebrate. This means that many Kirby fans are creating tributes to this adorable super tuff pink puff. One fan recently took advantage of the timely release of the Kirby and the Forgotten Land demo to create a mod crossing over this upcoming Kirby title with the equally iconic Devil May Cry franchise.

item.title: Xbox Giving Gold Subscribers Extra Free Game
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: Microsoft gives Xbox Live Gold subscribers the opportunity to claim an extra free Games with Gold game for March 2022.
item.content:encoded: Every month, Microsoft gives Xbox Live Gold subscribers four games to add to their digital libraries. Typically, this consists of two Xbox One games and two Xbox 360 games, but sometimes Microsoft breaks away from that pattern to offer Xbox Live Gold subscribers a little something extra. For example, one time Microsoft included an Xbox Series X game as part of the free Games with Gold when it gave away Gears 5 for free.

item.title: Destiny 2 Gambit Change Inadvertently Makes Hawkmoon Insanely OP
item.dc:creator: Derek Nichols
item.description: Following the recent Gambit changes in Destiny 2: Season of the Risen, one player discovers that the Hawkmoon has gotten a major damage boost.
item.content:encoded: Originally introduced in Forsaken, the PvPvE game mode known as Gambit provided Destiny 2 players a fresh experience to stand alongside the typical Crucible and PvE content. Mixing both elements together, teams of four battled enemy NPCs in order to pick up motes to deposit into a bank. Essentially a race to see who could not only fill their bank but defeat the Primeval boss first, opposing Destiny 2 teams could periodically invade to try and hinder the other squad.

item.title: Lost Ark Will Catch Up With Eastern Version 'Quickly'
item.dc:creator: Nicola Jean Kapron
item.description: According to Amazon Game Studios, the western version of MMORPG Lost Ark will catch up with the existing eastern version of the game quickly.
item.content:encoded: Lost Ark was recently brought to several western territories by Amazon Game Studios, but the game has been out in Korea for significantly longer. This means that the Korean version has significantly more content for gamers to go through. However, Amazon Game Studios has gone on the record stating that the western release of Lost Ark will catch up with the eastern version quickly.

item.title: Dr Disrespect 'Moving On' From Twitch Legal Dispute
item.dc:creator: Joshua Duckworth
item.description: In a brief post, YouTube streamer Dr Disrespect reveals that he is moving on from his legal dispute with Twitch, which banned him in 2020.
item.content:encoded: On June 26, 2020, a surprise announcement was made that Dr Disrespect had been banned from Twitch. Those first few hours and even days were confusing, as many were quick to point out that it was a permanent ban, and in the absence of answers, there was a ton of speculation as to why Dr Disrespect was banned from Twitch.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Closed PvP Test Coming in April
item.dc:creator: Rory Young
item.description: In the latest developer update from Overwatch 2 boss Aaron Keller, plans for the multiplayer shooter's first closed beta are announced.
item.content:encoded: As Overwatch players know, the state of the game hasn't been everything that the community has wanted. Overwatch 2's development has become Blizzard's priority, leading to little new content in the original game and little communication from Blizzard itself. That's exactly what Overwatch 2 game director Aaron Keller acknowledges and apologizes for in his latest developer update video. In turn, Keller also promises a change in direction that could get Overwatch 2 in players' hands sooner than expected.

item.title: GigaBash is a New Kaiju Brawler Game Coming This Year
item.dc:creator: Andrew Fleming
item.description: Indie developer Passion Republic Games is releasing the new Godzilla-inspired multiplayer game GigaBash to Playstation consoles soon.
item.content:encoded: The latest PlayStation State of Play event showcased several exciting titles making their way to Sony consoles this year and beyond. Included in the extensive line-up was a new trailer shining a light on the haunting streets of Ghostwire: Tokyo, releasing exclusively on PS5 and PC later this month. However, one curious beast titled GigaBash stood tall as part of the blast of content, unveiling a brand new multiplayer-battle kaiju experience.

item.title: Ender Lilies Passes 600,000 Units Sold
item.dc:creator: Matthew Van Bullock
item.description: Binary Haze Interactives’ Ender Lilies: Quietus of the Knights sells over 600,000 digital units
item.content:encoded: Binary Haze Interactives’ 2D action RPG, Ender Lilies: Quietus of the Knights was released in partnership with Limited Run Games in physical format on March 8th, 2022.

item.title: Monster Hunter Rise Version 3.9.1 Update Has Been Released
item.dc:creator: Neil Rickus
item.description: Monster Hunt Rise gets a minor update, including weekly Event Quests, new DLC from the Nintendo eShop and a range of bug fixes.
item.content:encoded: Capcom has released the latest patch for the popular Monster Hunter Rise, which contains bug fixes and updates to enhance the game.

item.title: Elden Ring Soft Cap Cheat Sheet Lets Players Know When to Stop Spending Points in Certain Skills
item.dc:creator: Andrew McPhillips
item.description: Fans put together a soft cap cheat sheet for Elden Ring that shows players when leveling certain stats will hit a point of diminishing returns.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring is a game that leaves a lot for the player to figure out for themselves. Without a reliance on mini-maps or waypoint markers, this is true both in the design of the game world and the character leveling system. Elden Ring’s stat leveling system combines with the vast number of weapons and spells to mean endless refinements can be made for a certain play-style.

item.title: Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga Trailer Highlights Multiple Worlds
item.dc:creator: Daire Behan
item.description: With Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga close to release, the developers showcase some of the most memorable planets featured in the game.
item.content:encoded: Even in the highly competitive early months of 2022, with games like Elden Ring becoming one of the highest-rated games of all time, hype is steady for TT Games' latest installment in the Lego Star Wars franchise. Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga is finally gearing up for release after almost three years since its announcement. Today, TT Games has released a developer diary detailing the game's dense open worlds.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Player Breaks Updated Climb Patch To Get Out of Bounds
item.dc:creator: Joseph Francis Docherty
item.description: One Cyberpunk 2077 player captures a video that shows how to break the latest update climb restraints and reach areas out of bounds.
item.content:encoded: Since Cyberpunk 2077 received its recent overhaul, it's safe to say that the game feels better than ever before as the update revitalizes almost every aspect of Night City. The list of said fixes includes tweaks to AI behavior and skill balance, adding additional elements to the world, and overhauling the driving mechanics. However, although Cyberpunk 2077's massive update added many new features, it also removed and capped quite a number too, including a limit on the double jump height. Now, one Reddit user has set out to break this limit by reaching areas of Night City that are out of bounds.

item.title: Serie A Players Featured In FIFA 22 Week 25 Team Of The Week
item.dc:creator: Shawn Wilken
item.description: Team of the Week for week 25 has been announced on FIFA 22, and newest group of players features several popular names from Italy's Series A league.
item.content:encoded: EA Sports revealed its FUT Team of the Week 25 for FIFA 22 Ultimate Team mode. The announcement, a positive one after EA's most-recent updates made headlines, includes the names of 23 stars and their starting overall grades, and all TOTW players will be available in FUT packs from March 9 until March 16.

item.title: Ghost of Tsushima: Legends PS Plus Version Causing Issues With Base Game PS5 Upgrade
item.dc:creator: Parth Bagaria
item.description: Players who redeem the PlayStation Plus version of Ghost of Tsushima: Legends are getting locked out of purchasing the Director’s Cut upgrade.
item.content:encoded: PlayStation Plus subscribers received 4 games in March and many considered it to be one of the best lineups in recent months. PS Plus members are currently able to download Ghost of Tsushima: Legends, ARK: Survival Evolved, Ghostrunner, and Team Sonic Racing at no extra cost. On March 15, they can also add the PS5 version of Grand Theft Auto Online to their accounts if they redeem it within the first 3 months of its launch.

item.title: Dead Space Remake Now Reportedly Aiming for 2023 Release Date
item.dc:creator: Filip Galekovic
item.description: The Dead Space Remake may now be targeting an early 2023 release date, according to sources, with the developer needing more time to polish it up.
item.content:encoded: Dead Space fans have been reinvigorated by the fact that Electronic Arts is working on a proper large-scale remake of the original game, but there's precious little hard information actually available about the game at this time. Developer streams are slowly revealing more about it as time goes on, but it hasn't had an official release date up until now.

item.title: Genshin Impact Fan Concept Brings The Three Archons to Hades
item.dc:creator: Hajrudin Krdzic
item.description: A recent fan-made Hades concept introduces three of the most popular Genshin Impact characters to the Underworld of Greek myth.
item.content:encoded: Genshin Impact has amassed a huge and enthusiastic player base that keeps growing each day. Even though it's free-to-play, Genshin Impact has become the fastest mobile game to reach $1 billion in revenue.

item.title: Lost Ark Adding New Raid and Story Content in March Update
item.dc:creator: Rory Young
item.description: Amazon delivers Lost Ark's March update, which includes a full new story chapter, an Abyss Raid, a new limited-time event, and more.
item.content:encoded: The Amazon-published MMO Lost Ark continues to be massively popular as one of Steam's most-played games. Free-to-play access to the MMO has certainly played a major part in Lost Ark's success, but so has the fact that Amazon localized a game that's been available for several years. That extra polish, years of availability in South Korea before being brought west, has given Lost Ark the momentum it needed to continue its launch success. It also means there's a pipeline of content arriving in Lost Ark faster than expected.

item.title: Granblue and Final Fantasy 11 Are Getting a Crossover
item.dc:creator: Ruby Lee Axel Modica
item.description: In honor of both Granblue Fantasy and Final Fantasy 11 celebrating big anniversaries, a crossover between the two is coming soon, leaving fans hyped.
item.content:encoded: Granblue Fantasy is an immersive JRPG series which recently announced its 8th anniversary on March 6, celebrating this event with a momentous anniversary stream. Along with the usual praise and appreciation for such a fan-favorite series, an intriguing crossover was subsequently declared for fans of the ever-evolving MMORPG Final Fantasy 11.

item.title: Gamescom to Return This August For Largest In-Person Gaming Event
item.dc:creator: Anthony James DeVetis
item.description: Following in the footsteps of 2021's Game Awards show, Gamescom will be welcoming back visitors in-person for its 2022 expo, as well as digitally.
item.content:encoded: It seems as if the pandemic is slowly making its way towards the endgame. In December 2021, The Game Awards staff made the decision to do an in-person event, marking one of the first major events anywhere to do so in the past 2 years. The event was a pretty big success all things considered, as the then rise of the Omicron variant was causing some hesitation towards meeting in-person. Now, Gamescom has announced its return in August 2022 with dates and the news that it will be returning to an in-person show, as well as continuing to host a digital component. The show will also play host towards Gamescom's first "climate-friendly" event.

item.title: PS5 DualSense Controller Design Tweak May End Stick Drift
item.dc:creator: Andrew McPhillips
item.description: The latest colors of PlayStation 5's DualSense controller receive a subtle component upgrade that could help to stave off stick drift.
item.content:encoded: The DualSense controller for the PlayStation 5 has received a lot of praise since the console's release in 2020. Its haptic feedback and triggers that adapt to what is happening in-game have been widely praised, and the controller is held as one of the best in recent console history. But this does not mean the DualSense is free from all the problems known to plague video game controllers.

item.title: PC Building Simulator 2 Announced for Epic Games Store
item.dc:creator: Andrew McPhillips
item.description: The sequel to PC Building Simulator, which allows players to build virtual gaming rigs, will be releasing some time this year on the Epic Games Store.
item.content:encoded: The tag-line “simulator” was originally only used by the most high-tech titles that promoted themselves as pushing the limits of graphical hardware, or systems that could realistically teach the player how to use a real-life piece of equipment. Now the simulator tag line has lost a lot of that meaning with “simulators” for everything from bread to document checking. It's rare to find one that truly dedicates itself to the re-creation of an activity or hobby.

item.title: Stylish Samurai Game Trek to Yomi Reveals Voice Cast
item.dc:creator: Michael Brandon Ingram
item.description: A new trailer for Trek to Yomi during the March State of Play broadcast showed off the game's story, revealing members of its star-studded cast.
item.content:encoded: Trek to Yomi stunned audiences when it was first revealed by Devolver Digital during last year's E3 conference. The stylish 2D action game features gorgeous monochrome visuals, references and homages to classic samurai films, and follows a young samurai named Hikori as he seeks revenge for a tragedy that befell his village. With the game set to release later this year, the ambitious samurai game has received multiple trailers showing off its cinematic action with the most recent reveal coming during Wednesday's State of Play broadcast.

item.title: MLB The Show 22 Reveals New Commentary Team
item.dc:creator: Shawn Wilken
item.description: San Diego Studio is making a big change to its MLB The Show 22 commentary team, replacing Matt Vasgersian after spending 16 years in the role.
item.content:encoded: MLB The Show 22 is making monumental changes to the way baseball fans play the game, both from a visual experience and the way it feels in the palms of their hands. The commentary team for this year's installment is also set for new life, as San Diego Studio announced new voices to its broadcast team.

item.title: Gundam Evolution Confirms Game Modes, Network Test
item.dc:creator: Trevor Edwards
item.description: Bandai Namco reveals a gameplay trailer for its upcoming mecha title Gundam Evolution, which confirms the game's modes and playtest date.
item.content:encoded: Bandai Namco has revealed a new gameplay trailer for its upcoming hero shooter Gundam Evolution. The free-to-play title currently in development's trailer showcases its various modes, a variety of pilotable Gundam units, and when fans can get their first crack at the game via a playtest.

item.title: Halo Infinite Players Can Get New Mongoose Skin If They're Subscribed to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate
item.dc:creator: Matthew Van Bullock
item.description: Halo Infinite players can grab a new mongoose skin as part of Xbox' Game Pass ultimate perks system
item.content:encoded: Xbox Game Pass Ultimate members can grab a new freebie skin for their Halo Infinite multiplayer Mongoose, and everybody loves a good freebie.

item.title: MLB The Show 22 Adds Mike Mussina To Legends Team
item.dc:creator: Shawn Wilken
item.description: MLB The Show 22 introduces its newest member to the Legends roster, featuring a Hall of Fame pitcher from the New York Yankees and Baltimore Orioles.
item.content:encoded: The Legends roster for MLB The Show 22 is adding a Hall of Fame pitcher that played for the Baltimore Orioles and New York Yankees. MLB The Show 22 teased the newest member earlier this week via Twitter, with the big reveal coming today, as planned.

item.title: WWE 2K22 Reveals All 28 DLC Characters and Release Dates
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: WWE 2K22 confirms all 28 DLC characters that will be added to the game's roster post-launch along with their release dates.
item.content:encoded: WWE 2K22 is launching with a whopping 163 wrestlers on its base game roster and 168 wrestlers for those that buy the pricier nWo 4-Life Edition. Beyond launch, WWE 2K22 fans can expect the game's roster of playable characters to grow, as 2K Sports has officially confirmed all 28 DLC characters that are coming to the game, including what DLC packs they will be a part of and when exactly they will be available.

item.title: Funny Overwatch Clip Sees Roadhog Using ‘Spider Sense’ To Hook Cloaked Sombra
item.dc:creator: Richard Warren
item.description: A fun Overwatch clip shows a Roadhog player catching a completely invisible Sombra, with the player using ‘Spider Sense’ to do so.
item.content:encoded: Overwatch is full of interesting characters, with Sombra and Roadhog having completely different mechanics despite both being plenty of fun to play. While it is possible to succeed with both characters, a recent Overwatch clip shows a Roadhog user getting the better of a Sombra - though neither side expected this to happen.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds New Day One Game and 3 Other Titles
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: Microsoft adds four more games to its Xbox Game Pass subscription service, including a brand-new day one release.
item.content:encoded: Microsoft updates its Xbox Game Pass subscription service with new games on a regular basis, oftentimes spreading out the new releases throughout the month. March 2022 has already seen a few new games hit the Xbox Game Pass subscription service, including Far: Changing Tides and Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy 13, and now four more games have been added to the lineup.

item.title: Destiny 2 Fixing Ascendant Alloy Bug, Offering Compensation With Update
item.dc:creator: Ishan Vashishth
item.description: Fans urge Bungie to fix the Ascendant Alloy Bug to which it responds by offering a generous compensation with the new update.
item.content:encoded: Destiny 2 has emerged as one of the most popular free-to-play franchises and has seen multiple updates and major expansions. Despite the immense popularity and player base, Bungie will not provide Destiny 2 for Steam Deck at this point due to some complicated reasons.

item.title: PlayStation Indie Game Sale Discounts More Than 1,000 Games
item.dc:creator: Alex Hopley
item.description: The latest PlayStation Indies sale gives fans a chance to buy a heap of indie gems for a heavy discount, including some of the genre's best.
item.content:encoded: Though many gamers enjoy the spectacle, vast open worlds and enhanced graphics of games with a massive, AAA budget, it's no secret that a lot of gaming fans also appreciate the smaller, indie titles out there. As smaller game developers are able to put out their creations more easily, the popularity of indie games has increased, with the genre evolving exponentially, even with its own online marketplaces such as the popular site Itch.io.

item.title: Rocket League Season 6 Gets Trailer
item.dc:creator: Andrew Fleming
item.description: In a new gameplay trailer, Psyonix studios reveal what additions are coming to Rocket League as part of season 6 and its new rocket pass.
item.content:encoded: Rocket League boasts a lot of content that's in line with the chaotic spirit of its vehicular soccer arena premise. As the next season of the popular e-sport game gets under way as part of patch 2.12, developers Psyonix have unveiled what additions are coming in a new gameplay trailer. With a lot of content on offer, the bombastic clip exhibits a new "animated" seasonal theme and Rocket Pass that includes, as always, several cosmetic items, a new playable van to its roster.

item.title: Intel Arc GPU Could Be Out as Late as June
item.dc:creator: Andrew Paul Heaton
item.description: Intel was supposedly releasing its anticipated Arc graphics cards at the start of this year, but it seems the company is still not ready to launch.
item.content:encoded: Many gamers and PC enthusiasts have been curious, and perhaps even eager, about the upcoming discrete graphics card range from Intel. Competing against the likes of Nvidia and AMD in the big leagues, the Arc Alchemist GPU has already missed its Q1 window, or at least it will do if it doesn't release by the end of this month. While it was allegedly supposed to launch sometime at the beginning of this year, it seems as though the company has pushed it back some, and now rumors speculate that the first line of its upcoming products may not be on shelves until the summer.

item.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure All Star Battle R Fighting Game Has Over 50 Playable Characters
item.dc:creator: Alex Hopley
item.description: The new JoJo's Bizarre Adventure fighting game was announced at yesterday's PlayStation showcase, and it boasts over fifty character to play.
item.content:encoded: 2022 is looking to be a stacked year for fighting games. While it has been a while since a mainline entry was released for one of the genre's major franchises, the end of last month brought the announcement of the highly anticipated Street Fighter 6. Yet, even with such a big reveal for the fighting game community, there's still more for fans to enjoy, such as a new JoJo's Bizarre Adventure fighting game.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Pro Accused of Cheating in Big Money Tournament
item.dc:creator: Alex Hopley
item.description: The Call of Duty: Warzone community investigates pro player Shifty after some suspicious clips emerge of the player during a tournament qualifier.
item.content:encoded: Call of Duty: Warzone, like many other competitive shooters, battle royales, and Call of Duty games, has an active competitive scene. Call of Duty: Warzone has had players competing for hundreds of thousands of dollars in the game, so it's safe to say that the pros of the game take tournaments seriously. As with any other competitive game or sport, cheating isn't welcome, and even glitches can cause pros to become unhappy with the way a tournament plays out, such as on one occasion when a Warzone player turned into a plane due to a glitch.

item.title: Dying Light 2 Patch Finally Fixes ‘Deathloop’ Bug, Makes Nights More Challenging
item.dc:creator: Andrew Paul Heaton
item.description: After Dying Light 2 came out, fans were noticing a game-breaking issue which this latest patch seems to fix, as well as changing other things.
item.content:encoded: Dying Light 2 has generally been received with favorable praise, with many extolling the improved parkour mechanics, not to mention the overall visuals. As one of the most anticipated open world zombie games of this generation, it's been a long wait for fans of the original. Since being released just over a month ago, there has been some urgency in the community as players encountered a game-breaking issue. Fortunately, Techland has been on the case and a new update seems to fix it, as well as bring with it some additional changes.

item.title: Leaked Screenshots of Supposed Bloodborne Remastered Get Debunked
item.dc:creator: Andrew Paul Heaton
item.description: Despite only coming out in 2015, many Bloodborne fans may be hoping a remaster will be in the make, but as it turns out, that's not on the cards yet.
item.content:encoded: The industry is currently going through something of a phase in which, instead of releasing unique games with compelling stories, publishers are churning out upscaled and graphically tweaked versions of already existing properties. While some video game remakes and remasters like Resident Evil 2 are considered good, there are others which painfully fail to hit the mark. The less said about the launch days of Grand Theft Auto: Definitive Edition, the better. Sometimes it's good to see improved versions of games that everyone loves, but there are times when fans' hopes can be dashed, as some Bloodborne players discovered.

item.title: Bungie's Next Game Could Be Third-Person
item.dc:creator: Filip Galekovic
item.description: The developer of Destiny, Bungie, seems to be working on a character-focused third-person action game and is currently hiring people for the job.
item.content:encoded: Though the studio's only major project for quite some time now has been Destiny, Bungie is now looking for ways to spread its proverbial wings with all-new projects. While this was to be expected, especially following Sony's acquisition of the company, some specifics about the studio's unannounced projects still come as a surprise.

item.title: Halo Infinite Players Are Still Having Trouble With Challenges Tracking Properly
item.dc:creator: Alex Hopley
item.description: Halo Infinite players are struggling to gain XP rewards for challenges they have completed due to a problem with how the game sees multiplayer matches
item.content:encoded: Halo Infinite's multiplayer did not get off to the best of starts. With what was considered a rocky launch by many, the Halo Infinite multiplayer beta had complaints regarding a variety of issues, from serious gameplay bugs affecting matchmaking, to problems with cosmetics in how much they cost and even their design. Though developer 343 is often releasing patches and updates in order to support the game as fans continue to play, it seems there are still persisting problems with the game.

item.title: New Skull and Bones Program Will Let Fans Play the Game Early
item.dc:creator: Jared Carvalho
item.description: Ubisoft announces a new program for the upcoming naval title Skull and Bones will allow fans to playtest early builds of the game.
item.content:encoded: With the development of Skull and Bones putting the release of this oncoming title in the distant future, Ubisoft has announced a new way for fans to get their hands on the game early. Specifically, this would let players get a look at the inner workings of the game ahead of the eventual 2023 release date of Skull and Bones, if Ubisoft's current predictions pan out accordingly.

item.title: Japanese Government Grants Hideo Kojima Award for Fine Arts
item.dc:creator: Andrew Paul Heaton
item.description: Famed video game auteur Hideo Kojima is given the Minster's Award for Fine Art, most notably for the Director's Cut of Death Stranding.
item.content:encoded: Hideo Kojima is one of the most well-known creators currently working in the video game industry, whose outpourings have earned him a reputation as something of a unique character when it comes to directing games. In fact, he's considered one of the most influential developers in the Japanese gaming industry, famous for the long-running Metal Gear series, as well as 2019's Death Stranding. Beginning his career in the mid-1980s, he has been in the thick of it for around three and a half decades, and now his contributions have received special recognition.

item.title: Marvel's Avengers Adding Spider-Man: Far From Home Suit
item.dc:creator: Parth Bagaria
item.description: Crystal Dynamics adds a new Spider-Man costume to PS5 and PS4 versions of Marvel's Avengers, based on the movie Spider-Man: Far from Home.
item.content:encoded: Marvel’s Avengers continues to get new content despite its mixed reception. Developer Crystal Dynamic had released the War for Wakanda expansion for Marvel’s Avengers last year and followed it up with the game’s first raid. The post-story content was a big focus of the criticism directed towards Marvel’s Avengers, but many users consider the Klaw Raid to be the best end-game content released for the game.

item.title: More Women Join Lawsuit Accusing Sony of Sexism
item.dc:creator: Filip Galekovic
item.description: The class-action lawsuit concerning sexism at Sony's PlayStation studios is now bolstered with 8 more reports, citing unwelcome advances and more.
item.content:encoded: Sony is currently in the midst of a class-action lawsuit centered around the allegations of widespread sexism at the company, with Sony's former IT security analyst, Emma Majo, bringing these allegations to the forefront. Though the company already requested for the court to dismiss the lawsuit, it seems to be picking up steam, instead.

item.title: Rune Factory 5 Gameplay Footage Shows How Players Can Spend Time With Their Significant Others
item.dc:creator: Luie Magbanua
item.description: Farming RPG Rune Factory 5 reveals new gameplay that shows the different activities players can do with their in-game significant other.
item.content:encoded: The fifth title in the Rune Factory series, Rune Factory 5, is releasing in a couple of weeks. On social media, both Marvelous Games and XSeed Games have been sharing more details about the title. This includes character videos, story trailers, and new Rune Factory 5 features that both long-time fans and new players will likely enjoy. Recently, new footage has appeared online showcasing that the farming RPG will let players spend more quality time with their chosen significant others in-game through a variety of different activities.

item.title: Elden Ring Player Has Extremely Creepy First Invasion Experience
item.dc:creator: Kean Sullivan
item.description: One unfortunate Elden Ring player gets invaded by three other players and the encounter is extremely bizarre to say the least.
item.content:encoded: Following the release of Elden Ring, many players have taken advantage of the numerous creative freedoms that the game provides. Considering how straight laced the formatting of most FromSoftware titles tend to be, Elden Ring provides its player base with much more open-ended gameplay opportunities. Although, this newfound freedom can sometimes lead to unexpected occurrences in-game.

item.title: Tweet on Official Resident Evil Account Gets Fans Speculating About Village DLC
item.dc:creator: Andrew Paul Heaton
item.description: While Capcom has still to confirm whether Resident Evil Village will be getting any DLC, a recent ambiguous post on Twitter gets some fans hoping.
item.content:encoded: The Resident Evil series has been a staple of the horror genre since gamers first laid eyes on the original way back in 1996. Even with its cheesy B-movie storyline, and comically wooden acting, or perhaps because of it, the Resident Evil series has become one of the most influential horror game franchises in history, spawning a series of sequels, reboots, remakes, and spin-offs. Village is the latest installment in the series, which has seen the modern take on the games go from strength to strength, and now it seems fans are, once again, hoping for some DLC to be announced.

item.title: EA Gets $11 Million Loot Box Fine Overturned
item.dc:creator: Bryce L. Jackson
item.description: Electronic Arts wins appeal of the ruling that led to the fine in the Dutch higher courts and will not have to pay fine or alter FIFA Ultimate Team.
item.content:encoded: The issue of how to address loot boxes in video games has become a hot-button issue. Certain countries have viewed the microtransaction practice as gambling fed to children and younger individuals and harmful to people with gambling addictions. FIFA Ultimate Team has one of the most notorious loot box methods in the gaming industry, and it led to many countries cracking down on loot boxes as a whole, with some taking Electronic Arts to court and winning. That win is now being overturned in the appeals court and EA will avoid paying a $11 Million fine.

item.title: Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin Surprise-Launches New Demo
item.dc:creator: Kit Morris
item.description: A new demo for Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin comes out today and was announced during PlayStation's newest State of Play.
item.content:encoded: Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin is an upcoming game developed by Koei Tecmo and Team Ninja that is directly inspired by the first game in the franchise. A new demo for Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin is out today.

item.title: Only 10% of Steam Gaming Sessions Use a Controller
item.dc:creator: Sarah Fields
item.description: Steam's annual review gives players interesting insights, including how many are using a controller over keyboard and mouse.
item.content:encoded: There are a lot of potential variables in PC gaming, but for gamers who prefer it as their system of choice, that's part of the fun. Customizing one's graphical and processing capabilities, accessories, and even input method is all up to the player, allowing for a fair amount of freedom in comparison to the average home gaming console.

item.title: New Mario Lego Set Featuring Princess Peach Revealed Early
item.dc:creator: Zackari Greif
item.description: With Mario Day closing in, an announcement post for Lego sets for the legendary Princess Peach posts earlier than it was meant to.
item.content:encoded: Ever since the first Super Mario Lego collections were revealed, Lego and Nintendo have seen a ton of success with the unique interactive playsets. Many fans have caused almost every single set of the series to sell out almost the instant they're announced, and it makes sense for Nintendo and Lego to continue to expand the series with that success. The next expansion seemingly deals with Princess Peach.

item.title: PS5 Console Exclusive Ghostwire: Tokyo Gets New Trailer at State of Play Event
item.dc:creator: Carl Mcfadyen
item.description: The official launch trailer for Ghostwire: Tokyo is out in the wild after being revealed during PlayStation’s latest State of Play event.
item.content:encoded: Ghostwire: Tokyo is due to release in the coming weeks, and fans have been treated to the launch trailer for the game during PlayStation's latest State of Play. This trailer gives fans another look at what to expect from Ghostwire: Tokyo.

item.title: 13 Classic Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Games Coming to New Consoles As Part of Cowabunga Collection
item.dc:creator: Trevor Edwards
item.description: Sony's State of Play showcase reveals Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Cowabunga Collection, which includes 13 classic TMNT titles.
item.content:encoded: Cowabunga it is. Nickelodeon, Digital Eclipse, and Konami have joined forces to give longtime Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles fans a treat in the form of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Cowabunga Collection. The upcoming title consists of 13 classic TMNT titles, including Konami's beat-em-up arcade titles and the infamously frustrating original platformer for NES.

item.title: Elden Ring Mod Adds Peaceful Mode
item.dc:creator: Christian Miller
item.description: The Lands Between are a dangerous place, and thanks to an Elden Ring mod that adds photo mode, players can enjoy its scenic environments in peace.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring is a beautiful game. FromSoftware has delivered a breathtaking title that not only offers thrilling gameplay, but it seeks to thrill the visual senses as well with its cinematic environments and sprawling landscapes. Some players have daydreamed about taking full advantage of the game's visuals, and given the high enthusiasm in its burgeoning modding community, the emergence of a photo mode in Elden Ring as a mod is hardly surprising.

item.title: TikToker Recreates Video Game Character Hairstyles in Viral Video
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: In a new viral video, TikTok content creator and Twitch streamer gingersnark recreates various video game character hairstyles.
item.content:encoded: TikTok has proven to be a great place to go for video game content, with some TikTok content creators even dressing up as their favorite video game characters. Sometimes these costumes require TikTokers to style their hair a certain way to accurately represent the character, with TikToker and Twitch streamer gingersnark showing off their impressive hairstyling skills in a new viral video.

item.title: Naughty Dog's Neil Druckmann Shows Off Elden Ring Character Dressed As a Clicker
item.dc:creator: Jared Stewart
item.description: Neil Druckmann shares a screenshot of his Elden Ring character wearing an outfit set that he has compared to The Last of Us' clickers.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring's gargantuan over-world map has engrossed fans, and each player's experience with its diverse biomes will be unique on a first playthrough. Tons of armor sets have been discovered in Elden Ring that grant unique appearances to the wearer, with one that has stood out lately to a notable figure in the video game industry.

item.title: Genshin Impact Reveals Most Used Spiral Abyss Characters for Update 2.5
item.dc:creator: Hajrudin Krdzic
item.description: The Spiral Abyss is probably the hardest part of Genshin Impact since it includes a diverse enemy lineup that requires constant adapting.
item.content:encoded: Genshin Impact has become one of the most popular titles in the gaming industry, with a huge player base that keeps growing each day. Each new update brings loads of content such as new regions and characters, as well as a new Spiral Abyss lineup.

item.title: Elden Ring Player Kills Margit With One Spell in Second Playthrough
item.dc:creator: Michael Eugene Arrieta Jr
item.description: One Elden Ring player shows how easy the game will be after starting a second playthrough of FromSoftware's rather difficult title.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring has proven to be quite the difficult title. The FromSoftware game holds back no punches, sending players to their death countless times. However, it seems things get a bit easier during a second playthrough of Elden Ring, as one player demonstrates during one of the game's boss battles.

item.title: Elden Ring Player Trolled By Message Under Ladder
item.dc:creator: Kaitlin Ann Meaney
item.description: An Elden Ring player reads a message left by another player under a ladder in the game and then ends up regretting that decision.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring is an online game where anyone can leave a message to hopefully help other players. In this case, a player read a message that ended up leading to their demise.

item.title: Valkyrie Profile Series Announces New Game Valkyrie Elysium
item.dc:creator: Rory Young
item.description: Square Enix surprises its fans by announcing that it's working on a follow-up to the Valkyrie Profile series, Valkyrie Elysium.
item.content:encoded: While many Square Enix fans watching Wednesday's PlayStation Play event were hopeful for a look at the latest game from one of the publisher's iconic franchises, they surely didn't expect what they received. Instead of Final Fantasy 16 or Dragon Quest 12, Square Enix officially unveiled the newest game in the Valkyrie Profile series, named Valkyrie Elysium. Further, the tactics-based action RPG is a confirmed release for both PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 in 2022.

item.title: Forspoken Trailer Features Giant Dragon and Other Enemies
item.dc:creator: Edoardo Fontana
item.description: The new RPG from Square Enix Forspoken gets a new trailer, filled to the brim with many interesting gameplay mechanics.
item.content:encoded: The release date of Square Enix's Forspoken just got a big delay of five months, but at least fans can enjoy a brand-new trailer. Released during the latest PlayStation State of Play, the video is brief, yet filled with promising content.

item.title: Funny Elden Ring Image Shows What Game Would Look Like as an Ubisoft Open World
item.dc:creator: Michael Eugene Arrieta Jr
item.description: A humorous image surfaced that shows how FromSoftware's Elden Ring would look if Ubisoft developed the open world RPG instead.
item.content:encoded: If there is one thing that Elden Ring has, it is a clean UI. Things do not feel too cluttered, with only the essentials that players need appearing on the screen. While FromSoftware has done a good job keeping things tidy, one gamer has created an image of what they think the UI would look like if Ubisoft developed Elden Ring, and it is not pretty.

item.title: Elden Ring Glitch Shows What the Game Would Be Like If The Camera Was Top-Down
item.dc:creator: Parth Bagaria
item.description: An Elden Ring player finds an exploit that prevents fall damage and allows them to continue playing from a top-down perspective.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring encourages the player base to explore every inch of the world. It’s filled with secrets and hidden paths, but fans may even come across some glitches along the way. While Elden Ring’s performance issues are well-documented, it looks like the bugs are not that serious and hopefully, players will not run into any game-breaking issues.

item.title: Sony Suspends All PlayStation Sales in Russia
item.dc:creator: Kaitlin Ann Meaney
item.description: Sony is joining the mass of other video game companies and other big corporations by suspending all PlayStation sales in Russia.
item.content:encoded: The war in Ukraine is prompting many companies to cease or suspend operations in Russia in response to the invasion. Joining the slew of companies that already includes massive corporations like McDonald's, Starbucks, and Coca-Cola, video game giant Sony has announced the suspension of all PlayStation sales in Russia for the foreseeable future.

item.title: Microsoft Takes Home Award for Metacritic’s Publisher of the Year
item.dc:creator: Daniel DeAngelo
item.description: Metacritic ranks Microsoft as 2021’s best video game publisher with an average Metascore of 87.4 percent, more than any previous year’s winner.
item.content:encoded: Console gamers sometimes make a big deal about the rivalry between Microsoft, Sony, and Nintendo. The discourse primarily focuses on the popularity or technical specs of each corporation’s console, but their role as game publishers is arguably just as important.

item.title: WWE 2K22 Servers Are Down for Many Players
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: The WWE 2K22 online multiplayer servers appear to be having problems, with many players unable to access the online game modes.
item.content:encoded: WWE 2K22's official release date is Friday, March 11, but those who are willing to pay a little extra are able to get early access. By purchasing the $99.99 Digital Deluxe Edition or the $119.99 nWo 4-Life Edition, fans can jump into WWE 2K22 right now. Unfortunately, those hoping to check out the game's online features may be disappointed right now, as the servers appear to be down for many players.

item.title: Exoprimal is New Co-Op Dinosaur Game With Mechs
item.dc:creator: Rory Young
item.description: To start Sony's PlayStation State of Play event, Capcom announces a brand new IP that combines mech suits and dinosaur warfare.
item.content:encoded: On Wednesday, Sony's PlayStation State of Play event started off in a surprising and exciting way. A trailer began with a vortex appearing above a city, and from the hole, dozens of dinosaurs began falling out it in a flood. When Capcom's logo later flashed, fans' eyebrows raised at the possibility of Dino Crisis returning in a new form. The new game revealed from Capcom isn't Dino Crisis, however. It's named Exoprimal, and it's as intriguing as it is confusing.

item.title: Have a Nice Death Gets Gorgeous Early Access Trailer
item.dc:creator: Amari Giles
item.description: The new video game Have a Nice Death receives a brand new Early Access trailer that shows off more gameplay to players.
item.content:encoded: The Game Awards 2021 showed several new video games to the world, one of which is the game Have a Nice Death being developed by Magic Design Studios and published by Gearbox Publishing. An announcement trailer for Have a Nice Death was shown revealing the 2D gameplay action that players can expect in its full release.

item.title: Square Enix Reveals New Strategy Game The DioField Chronicle
item.dc:creator: Greysun Morales
item.description: During Sony's State of Play presentation for March, Square Enix reveals The DioField Chronicle, a new strategy RPG.
item.content:encoded: Today, Sony held a livestreamed State of Play presentation to reveal new titles and updates for games coming to PlayStation platforms, with most of the titles shown coming from Japanese developers and publishers. Square Enix showed up at the event with some titles of its own, and one of those games is called The DioField Chronicle, a brand-new strategy RPG that uses a real-time tactical battle combat system. It looks very similar to the Fire Emblem series, with battle scenarios viewed from a top-down perspective.

item.title: Returnal Ascension Update Adding Co-Op and Survival Mode
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: Popular PlayStation 5 exclusive game Returnal is getting a huge free update that will add a campaign co-op mode and the Tower of Sisyphus.
item.content:encoded: One of the most critically-acclaimed new releases of 2021 was Housemarque's Returnal, a brutal but beautiful third-person shooter mixed with roguelike elements. Housemarque has continued to support Returnal since its launch by releasing updates that mainly work to address fan feedback, but soon the game will be getting its most substantial update to date. And better yet, it will be completely free.

item.title: Artist Combines Pokemon and Elden Ring to Make New Versions of Voltorb and Electrode
item.dc:creator: Kit Morris
item.description: An artistic Pokemon fan shows what Electric Pokemon Voltorb and Electrode would look like if they were in Elden Ring.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring and Pokemon Legends: Arceus are currently two of the biggest titles that gamers have been paying attention to in recent weeks. One fan has used their artistic talents to combine the two.

item.title: Strange Elden Ring Clip Shows Dragon Killing Itself Mid-Fight
item.dc:creator: David Coulson
item.description: A strange clip shows a player getting a bit of help from Elden Ring as a boss defeats itself with almost full health remaining.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring will certainly go down in the history books as one of the most difficult games of this generation, with FromSoftware picking up exactly where it left off with games such as Dark Souls, Bloodbourne, and Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice.

item.title: Elden Ring Player's First Invasion Goes Terribly Wrong
item.dc:creator: Dalton Cooper
item.description: An Elden Ring player attempts their very first invasion in the game, but unfortunately for them, it does not go as planned.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring is not a Dark Souls game, but it still has a lot in common with FromSoftware's previous works. Like the Dark Souls games, Elden Ring has a unique take on PvP multiplayer, wherein players are able to invade the worlds of others. Sometimes Elden Ring invaders are able to take out their opponents with ease and ruin their runs, but other times the invader is bested and sent back to their own world in disgrace.

item.title: Stadia is Getting Games From Paradox Interactive and Team17
item.dc:creator: Michael Brandon Ingram
item.description: Stadia announced that three games from Paradox Interactive and Team17, including Cities: Skylines, are coming to the platform this Spring.
item.content:encoded: Since Stadia launched as Google's big foray into cloud-based gaming in late 2019, the platform has built up a solid roster of games over the 2+ years since its debut with more games frequently being added to the service. From popular indie games like Gamious's laid-back simulation game Lake to major AAA titles like Far Cry 6 and Destiny 2, the library of games available to play on Stadia has been growing with each passing month. Now, the Stadia team has officially unveiled a trio of titles from Paradox and Team17 set to hit Stadia this spring.

item.title: Hilarious Elden Ring Clip Shows Dragon Fool Player Into Falling to Their Death
item.dc:creator: Clayton Sterling Cyre
item.description: An Elden Ring player discovers a dragon floating in mid-air below a cliffside as they fall to their death, while the dragon remains untouched.
item.content:encoded: Bandai Namco and FromSoftware released Elden Ring at the end of February and fans continue to discover hidden details, formulate ideal strategies for the bestiary of enemies, and occasionally coming across some bugs. One such player was recently tricked by a floating dragon that appeared to be walking on the ground below which ended up being a lot further away than the Elden Ring fan expected.

item.title: Elden Ring Speedrunner Beats Game in Under an Hour
item.dc:creator: Carl Mcfadyen
item.description: Despite only being released 12 days ago, a YouTuber sets an immensely impressive speedrun time for the completion of Elden Ring.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring has taken over the video game industry since it released, managing to infuriate and endear itself to players all at the same time. One gamer has managed to beat Elden Ring ridiculously quickly, despite the iconic FromSoftware challenge standing in their way.

item.title: Elden Ring Fan Creates Beric Dondarrion from Game of Thrones
item.dc:creator: Ishan Vashishth
item.description: Elden Ring's character creator makes the headlines again with a player creating the famous Game of Thrones character, Beric Dondarrion.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring has constantly been in the news since its launch in February. It has already become From Software's biggest Steam launch and has the potential to reach even greater heights. Some facets of the game deserve special credit for the incredible sales performance of Elden Ring.

item.title: Some Elden Ring Players Didn't Know They Could Sort Their Inventory
item.dc:creator: Ishan Vashishth
item.description: A large chunk of Elden Ring fans were utterly unaware of the fact that they could sort their inventory based on multiple criteria.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring is on the road to becoming one of the biggest releases of the year. Elden Ring has enjoyed stunning sales figures, and the game has already gained the title of FromSoftware's biggest Steam launch, surpassing Sekiro and the Dark Souls series.

item.title: Steam Added 31 Million New Users Last Year
item.dc:creator: Tyler Shipley
item.description: Valve gives an in-depth update on the success of Steam, revealing that the platform saw an impressive amount of growth throughout 2021.
item.content:encoded: While 2022 is already well underway, gamers are still learning new information about how well video game companies performed in 2021. For example, Steam, the video game digital distribution service from Valve, recently released details about its platform growth throughout 2021, and the results were what many probably expected: excellent.

item.title: Someone Added a Tracker to Their Steam Deck Using an Air Tag
item.dc:creator: Oliver VanDervoort
item.description: While Steam Deck doesn't come with a way for users to track or find their devices, an Apple Air Tag could be a quick fix for that problem.
item.content:encoded: Now that the Steam Deck is out in the wild, users are learning and figuring out all kinds of different things about the handheld game console. In fact, one enterprising Steam Deck user has even figured out how to incorporate an Apple Air Tag into the device so that people can have a way to track it should they lose it while playing it on the go.

item.title: PlayStation State of Play: How to Watch Today's Showcase
item.dc:creator: Rory Young
item.description: Sony's March PlayStation State of Play is starting soon and here are all of the ways that PS4 and PS5 fans can watch the show.
item.content:encoded: PlayStation's fans have anxiously been waiting for news on Sony's plans for mid and late-2022. Their patience was rewarded recently with the announcement of a new PlayStation State of Play event, which will air today, Wednesday, at 2:00 PM PT. The show will focus on PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 game updates, reveals, and announcements, and will last around 20 minutes. All that's left is for PlayStation fans to make sure they don't miss the show, so here are all of the ways that the State of Play can be watched.

item.title: Final Fantasy 35th Anniversary Website Launches
item.dc:creator: Kit Morris
item.description: A website dedicated to news on Final Fantasy launches for the franchise's 35th anniversary ahead of upcoming games releasing this year.
item.content:encoded: Final Fantasy is one of the most popular RPG series in the world. The first installment released back on December 18, 1987, and a website has been made to celebrate its 35th anniversary.

item.title: Saints Row Legacy Edition is Available Now for Pre-Order
item.dc:creator: Carl Mcfadyen
item.description: The Saints Row reboot is only months away from launch, and potential players can now pre-order the Legacy Edition of the game.
item.content:encoded: Saints Row is undergoing a soft reboot with its upcoming release on August 23. This reboot, simply titled Saints Row, is available for pre-order, with the most expensive option being the Legacy Edition.

item.title: F-Zero X is Coming to Nintendo Switch Online
item.dc:creator: Kit Morris
item.description: Nintendo announces that F-Zero X will becoming to the Nintendo Switch Online Expansion Pack soon, and fans are excited.
item.content:encoded: F-Zero X was one of the best racing games on the Nintendo 64. Fans and newcomers will soon be able to play F-Zero X on the Switch in two days through a Nintendo Switch Online Expansion Pack membership.

item.title: Elden Ring Director Was Nervous About Release
item.dc:creator: Tanner Fox
item.description: FromSoftware have a reputation for excellence, but president Hidetaka Miyazaki admits to being nervous before the launch of Elden Ring.
item.content:encoded: Japanese developer FromSoftware’s most ambitious title to date, Elden Ring was met with near-universal praise when it debuted in February, and, according to UK sales metrics, it’s one of the most successful non-Call of Duty or FIFA game launches since Rockstar’s Red Dead Redemption 2 in 2018. That said, according to a new interview in Famitsu magazine, director Hidetaka Miyazaki was nervous as ever for Elden Ring's debut.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Update Causing Problems on Steam Deck
item.dc:creator: Rory Young
item.description: Final Fantasy 14's latest update appears to have broken support of the MMO on Valve's new handheld PC platform, the Steam Deck.
item.content:encoded: Valve's Steam Deck is now shipping out to early preorderers of the handheld PC device. It's a new idea, a proprietary console made by Valve with a custom Linux-based OS designed specifically for PC games. As with most new ideas, there are still some kinks to work out. Take for example Final Fantasy 14, which was advertised for the Steam Deck by Valve CEO Gabe Newell. A new update for the MMO has rendered Final Fantasy 14 completely unplayable on the Steam Deck, with no fix in sight.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Has Unique Evolution Idea For Sprigatito
item.dc:creator: Clayton Sterling Cyre
item.description: Pokemon fans continue to speculate on what Pokemon Scarlet and Violet starters will look like after evolving, including a bandit look for Sprigatito.
item.content:encoded: The Pokemon Company and Nintendo recently revealed the next generation of Pokemon with Pokemon Scarlet and Violet, which release later this year. Since the teaser trailer, Pokemon fans have taken to the new starter Pokemon and have speculated on what their evolutions may look like, including a unique bandit look for Sprigatito.

item.title: Microsoft Activision Blizzard Acquisition Reportedly Being Investigated for Insider Trading
item.dc:creator: Reece Reid
item.description: Microsoft's blockbuster Activision Blizzard acquisition is now under investigation after reports of three investors being accused of insider trading.
item.content:encoded: The dust has finally settled on Microsoft's record-breaking buyout of Activision Blizzard, and as expected more than a few investigations are being conducted regarding the finer details of the deal. The latest investigation now relates to some Activision Blizzard investors possibly being involved in insider trading.

item.title: Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp Gets Lengthy Delay
item.dc:creator: Nathan Lee
item.description: Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp is being delayed again, this time out of consideration for current world events happening in Europe.
item.content:encoded: As the war between Russia and Ukraine continues, a number of companies in the video game industry have announced changes to some of their business practices involving the two countries. Earlier this morning, Nintendo made the announcement that it will be delaying its strategy game Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp to an unspecified date. Given the content of Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp involves modern combat, Nintendo likely felt releasing this game right now would be in poor taste.

item.title: Elden Ring Fan Creates Pixel Version of Game's Box Art
item.dc:creator: Alex Hopley
item.description: An Elden Ring fan decides to show what some of the game's art might've looked like if it had released in a more retro era.
item.content:encoded: It's no secret that Elden Ring is one of the most popular games on the market right now. FromSoftware's latest fantasy RPG with notoriously difficult combat has lived up to and exceeded expectations according to many. It is currently one of the highest rated games of all time, and it seems that Elden Ring's popularity will only continue to grow over time as more fans pick up the game and create their own Tarnished.

item.title: Elden Ring Tip Will Help Players Keep Track of Completed Dungeons
item.dc:creator: David Coulson
item.description: There are many dungeons and bosses to be found in Elden Ring and this map trick can make keeping track of them much easier
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring has become one of the most popular games in the world, with Elden Ring having one of the highest concurrent player records on Steam. FromSoftware's latest title picks up where Dark Souls left off with its difficult gameplay that will punish players.

item.title: Ghostwire Tokyo Visual Novel Available Now
item.dc:creator: Alex Hopley
item.description: The free prelude for upcoming horror title Ghostwire: Tokyo is available now for players looking to get an insight into the story.
item.content:encoded: As the latest game from the developers of the Evil Within series, Ghostwire: Tokyo had the interest of horror gamers since it was first unveiled back at E3 2019. For a while, all that fans knew about the title was that it would include horror elements, that the majority of the population had gone missing, and, as the name would suggest, it is set in Tokyo. Now, though, not only do those looking forward to the upcoming release of Ghostwire: Tokyo have some solid information on the game, they also have an introduction into its world.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Lethal Luxury Bundle Has Visual Glitch
item.dc:creator: Andrew McPhillips
item.description: A visual glitch is being reported with the purchasable Lethal Luxury Tracer skin in Call of Duty: Warzone that will block players' field of view.
item.content:encoded: Call of Duty: Warzone season 2 has been going for a few weeks now, and it remains massively popular. But there have been reports from players that the game is marred with glitches and bugs. This isn't usually a huge problem for games like Warzone which are continually worked on and updated. It can be expected that any bugs will be ironed out in short order. But it can be more frustrating when the glitch is part of a DLC pack paid for with real money.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Trick Gets Players Tons of Money At The Start of a Match
item.dc:creator: Richard Warren
item.description: A Call of Duty: Warzone player discovers a quick way to rack up money after landing, sharing their game-changing strategy with others online.
item.content:encoded: While Call of Duty: Warzone players need to be good at killing in order to find success, looting is equally important. Earning money is crucial, as it allows Call of Duty: Warzone players to purchase tools like UAVs and self-revives - and one gamer has found a way to get lots of it fast.

item.title: Elden Ring Clip Shows Why Magic Users Should Always Pay Attention to How Much MP They Have Left
item.dc:creator: Andrew McPhillips
item.description: A magic user in Elden Ring realizes too late they don’t have enough FP left for a weapon skill when running in for the final hit against a boss.
item.content:encoded: Elden Ring has exploded in popularity since its release, even becoming one of the most concurrently played games on Steam. It has the same DNA as FromSoftware’s other games, but its status as a new IP means more new players are willing to try it out. It is also more accessible than ever to play the class of character one wants, but this doesn’t mean these games have lost their unforgiving edge.
